executive_summary.overview: ProctorGuard is an enterprise-grade online proctoring platform designed specifically for corporate customers and professional certification bodies. The platform enables organizations to administer secure, remotely proctored examinations while maintaining full compliance with privacy regulations and accessibility standards.
key_differentiators: Comprehensive threat detection for AI assistance and secondary devices
Transparent appeals process with full evidence access
Fully automated operation without human proctors
executive_summary.product_vision: To become the trusted standard for automated online proctoring in corporate and professional certification contexts, where exam integrity, candidate experience, and regulatory compliance are equally prioritized.

primary_segments.description: Departments administering compliance certifications, skills assessments, and professional development exams
IT certifications, financial services credentials, healthcare licensing, and trade certifications
Organizations requiring secure remote examination capabilities
Organizations with distributed workforces requiring standardized assessment capabilities

threat_model.overview: The platform addresses four primary threat categories representing the most significant risks to exam integrity in corporate and certification contexts.

threats.name: AI Assistance
threats.description: Candidates may attempt to use AI-powered tools such as ChatGPT, Claude, or specialized exam assistance software to generate answers during proctored examinations.
attack_vectors: Voice-activated AI assistants (Siri, Alexa, Google Assistant)

detection_requirements.requirement: Real-time browser activity monitoring to detect attempts to access AI websites, browser extensions, or web-based AI tools
Audio monitoring for voice-activated AI assistant detection with keyword spotting for common activation phrases
Answer pattern analysis to identify responses characteristic of AI-generated content including vocabulary consistency, response timing patterns, and structural indicators
Process monitoring on locked-down devices to detect AI applications running in background
Clipboard monitoring to detect paste operations that may indicate content copied from AI tools
Network traffic analysis to identify connections to known AI service endpoints

mitigation_strategies: Lockdown browser prevents access to AI websites and blocks known AI browser extensions
Network traffic analysis to identify connections to AI service endpoints
Question design guidance for exam creators to develop AI-resistant assessment items
Regularly updated blocklist of AI service domains and applications

threats.name: Insider Threats
threats.description: Scenarios where individuals with legitimate access to exam content, systems, or processes abuse their privileges, including exam administrators leaking questions, IT staff manipulating results, or collusion between personnel and candidates.
attack_vectors: Collusion between proctoring personnel and candidates
Managers providing unauthorized assistance to team members
Unauthorized bulk export of exam questions

detection_requirements.requirement: Comprehensive audit logging of all administrative actions including exam content access, result modifications, and configuration changes
Anomaly detection for unusual access patterns such as bulk question exports, after-hours access, or access from unusual locations
Statistical analysis of exam results to identify suspicious patterns indicating advance knowledge of questions
Segregation of duties enforcement preventing single individuals from both creating and administering exams

mitigation_strategies: Role-based access control with principle of least privilege
Multi-party approval workflows for sensitive operations
Encryption of exam content at rest with multi-custodian key management
Immutable audit logs stored separately from operational systems
Mandatory access reviews on quarterly basis

threats.name: Impersonation
threats.description: Someone other than the registered candidate attempts to take an exam on their behalf, ranging from complete proxy substitution to partial assistance for specific questions.
attack_vectors: Complete proxy substitution (another person takes entire exam)
Partial assistance (someone provides answers for specific questions)
Photo or video spoofing during identity verification
Mask or prosthetic use to defeat facial recognition

detection_requirements.requirement: Pre-exam identity verification comparing live capture against government-issued photo ID with anti-spoofing measures
Continuous facial recognition throughout the exam session to verify the same person remains present
Detection of multiple faces in the camera frame indicating potential assistance
Behavioral biometrics including typing patterns and mouse movement characteristics to detect mid-exam substitution
Voice recognition for audio-based verification if enabled

mitigation_strategies: Liveness detection to prevent use of photos, videos, or masks
Periodic re-verification prompts during longer exams
Integration with HRIS to validate candidate employment status and organizational affiliation

threats.name: Secondary Devices
threats.description: Candidates use secondary devices such as smartphones, tablets, smartwatches, or additional computers to access unauthorized resources during exams.
attack_vectors: Smartphone for searching answers or communicating
Smartwatch receiving messages or displaying notes

detection_requirements.requirement: Visual detection of secondary devices in the camera frame using computer vision
Audio analysis for notification sounds, vibrations, or conversation indicating device use
Detection of reflective surfaces that might display secondary device content
Gaze tracking to identify frequent off-screen looks indicating device reference
Network scanning to identify additional devices on the same local network during exam session

mitigation_strategies: Mandatory room scan procedure before exam start
Optional phone sequestration feature requiring phones in view or confirmed elsewhere
Clear pre-exam instructions about prohibited devices with acknowledgment requirement
Periodic random environment checks during exam

technical_architecture.overview: ProctorGuard employs a hybrid web and native application architecture deployed in a single-region cloud environment, balancing accessibility, security, and operational simplicity.

deployment_model.data_residency: All data stored within selected region to meet compliance requirements
deployment_model.disaster_recovery: Cross-availability-zone replication with defined RTO and RPO

modules.name: Administration Console
features: Exam configuration and question bank management

native_applications.purpose: Lockdown browser for secure exam delivery
features: Secure browser environment preventing unauthorized application access

compute.ml_inference: GPU-enabled instances for real-time AI analysis

storage.document_store: MongoDB or DocumentDB for session recordings metadata
storage.object_storage: S3/Blob storage for video recordings and evidence
storage.cache: Redis for session management and real-time data

networking.cdn: CloudFront/Azure CDN for static assets and application delivery
networking.load_balancing: Application load balancer with SSL termination
networking.api_gateway: Managed API gateway for rate limiting and authentication

identity_verification.overview: Comprehensive identity verification system with advanced anti-spoofing measures to prevent impersonation attacks.

steps.name: Document Capture
steps.description: Candidate photographs government-issued ID using device camera
requirements: Support for passport, driver's license, national ID cards
Image quality validation with guidance for recapture

steps.name: Document Validation
requirements: Format and structure validation against known templates

steps.name: Biometric Capture
steps.description: Live capture of candidate facial biometrics
requirements: Multiple angle capture for 3D modeling where supported

steps.name: Liveness Detection
steps.description: Anti-spoofing verification to confirm live person
requirements: Active liveness challenges (head movement, expression changes)
Passive liveness analysis (texture, depth, reflection patterns)
Presentation attack detection (photos, videos, masks, deepfakes)
Minimum confidence threshold configurable by organization

steps.name: Face Matching
steps.description: Comparison of live capture against ID document photo
requirements: Tolerance for aging and minor appearance changes
Configurable match threshold with organizational override
Fallback to manual review for edge cases

steps.name: HRIS Validation
requirements: Department and role validation if required
Photo comparison against HRIS profile photo if available

presentation_attack_detection.description: Detection of attempts to present fake biometric samples

capabilities.detection_method: Texture analysis, lack of 3D depth, reflection patterns
Moire pattern detection, screen reflection, pixel artifacts
Skin texture analysis, eye reflection analysis, thermal patterns if available
Temporal inconsistency detection, facial landmark analysis, generation artifact detection

continuous_verification.description: Ongoing identity verification throughout exam session
features: Periodic face re-verification at configurable intervals
Alert on face not detected for configurable duration
Multiple face detection triggering immediate flag

requirements.requirement: System shall support government-issued photo ID verification including passports, driver's licenses, and national ID cards
System shall implement active and passive liveness detection achieving minimum 99.5% accuracy against presentation attacks
System shall perform continuous facial recognition throughout exam session with configurable verification intervals
System shall detect and flag multiple faces in camera frame within 2 seconds
System shall integrate with HRIS to validate candidate identity against employee records
System shall provide fallback verification workflow when automated verification fails
Anti-spoofing system shall detect printed photos, screen displays, video replays, and 3D masks with minimum 99% accuracy

environment_control.overview: Lockdown browser implementation ensuring candidates cannot access unauthorized resources during examinations.

lockdown_browser.description: Native application creating a secure, isolated environment for exam delivery

browser_restrictions: Single full-screen window without minimize, resize, or close options during exam
Disabled address bar preventing URL entry
Blocked navigation controls (back, forward, refresh hotkeys)
Prevented new window or tab creation
system_restrictions: System tray and notification center suppressed
Screen capture and recording software blocked
Clipboard cleared on exam start and isolated during exam
Virtual machine detection with configurable policy
network_controls: DNS filtering to block known unauthorized domains
Allowlist mode permitting only exam-related endpoints
process_monitoring: Detection of prohibited applications attempting to launch
Background process scanning for AI tools and communication applications

requirements.requirement: Lockdown browser shall prevent access to all applications except the exam interface during active exam sessions
System shall block all keyboard shortcuts that could be used to switch applications or access system functions
System shall detect and block screen capture, screen recording, and screen sharing software
System shall detect virtual machine environments and enforce configurable policy (block or allow with flag)
System shall detect remote desktop connections and prevent exam delivery when detected
System shall isolate clipboard contents preventing copy/paste from external sources
System shall perform network traffic analysis to detect connections to unauthorized services
System shall provide graceful degradation and recovery if lockdown browser crashes during exam

ai_explainable_flags.overview: AI-powered behavior analysis system providing transparent, explainable flags for potential integrity violations with full audit trail and evidence linking.

design_principles.description: Every flag must be accompanied by clear, human-understandable explanation of why it was triggered
All flags must be linked to specific, reviewable evidence (video timestamps, audio clips, screenshots)
Each flag includes confidence level to support appropriate escalation and review prioritization
System actively monitors for and mitigates demographic bias in flag generation
Consistent flagging behavior across similar situations to build user trust

flags.name: Face Not Detected
flags.description: Candidate's face not visible in camera frame
flags.explanation_template: Face not detected in camera frame for {duration} seconds starting at {timestamp}. The candidate may have moved out of frame or camera may be obstructed.

flags.name: Multiple Faces Detected
flags.description: More than one face visible in camera frame
flags.explanation_template: Additional face detected in camera frame at {timestamp}. {count} faces were visible for {duration} seconds. This may indicate unauthorized assistance.

flags.name: Face Mismatch
flags.description: Current face does not match verified identity
flags.explanation_template: Facial recognition confidence dropped to {confidence}% at {timestamp}, below the {threshold}% threshold. The current face may not match the verified candidate.

flags.name: Secondary Device Detected
flags.description: Potential secondary device visible in frame
flags.explanation_template: Object identified as potential {device_type} detected at {timestamp} in {location} of frame with {confidence}% confidence.

flags.name: Suspicious Audio
flags.description: Audio anomaly detected suggesting external assistance
flags.explanation_template: Audio analysis detected {audio_type} at {timestamp}. Characteristics: {description}. This may indicate {interpretation}.

flags.name: Gaze Deviation
flags.description: Candidate looking away from screen frequently
flags.explanation_template: Candidate gaze direction deviated significantly from screen {count} times in {duration} minute period ending at {timestamp}. Average deviation: {degrees} degrees {direction}.

flags.name: Prohibited Application Detected
flags.explanation_template: Attempt to launch or switch to prohibited application '{app_name}' detected at {timestamp}. Application category: {category}. Action taken: {action}.

flags.name: Network Anomaly
flags.explanation_template: Connection attempt to {domain} detected at {timestamp}. This domain is categorized as {category}. Connection was {action}.

flags.name: Browser Integrity Violation
flags.explanation_template: Browser lockdown integrity check failed at {timestamp}. Violation type: {violation_type}. This may indicate an attempt to {interpretation}.

flags.name: Response Pattern Anomaly
flags.description: Answer patterns suggest potential AI assistance
flags.explanation_template: Response to question {question_id} shows characteristics associated with AI-generated content. Indicators: {indicators}. Confidence: {confidence}%.

flags.name: Timing Anomaly
flags.description: Response timing suggests external resource use
flags.explanation_template: Response time for question {question_id} was {time} which is {deviation} standard deviations from expected. Pattern suggests {interpretation}.

flags.name: Typing Pattern Change
flags.description: Significant change in typing behavior detected
flags.explanation_template: Typing pattern analysis shows significant deviation from baseline at {timestamp}. Metrics changed: {metrics}. This may indicate {interpretation}.

natural_language_explanations.description: All flags include human-readable explanations suitable for candidates and reviewers
requirements: Explanations written at 8th grade reading level
Specific evidence cited in each explanation
Possible innocent explanations acknowledged where applicable

evidence_linking.description: Direct links from flags to supporting evidence
requirements: One-click navigation from flag to evidence
Synchronized playback of video/audio at exact timestamp
Side-by-side comparison views for identity flags
Evidence preservation with chain of custody

confidence_scoring.description: Quantified confidence levels for all AI-generated flags

levels.interpretation: Weak signal, may be false positive

bias_monitoring.description: Continuous monitoring for demographic bias in flag generation
requirements: Aggregate flag rate analysis by demographic group
Alert when disparity exceeds configurable threshold
Model retraining triggers when bias detected

requirements.requirement: Every AI-generated flag shall include a natural language explanation describing the specific behavior or event that triggered the flag
Every flag shall be linked to specific, timestamped evidence that can be reviewed by candidates and administrators
All flags shall include a confidence score indicating the AI system's certainty level
System shall maintain complete audit trail of all flag generation, review, and resolution activities
System shall provide bias monitoring dashboard showing flag distribution across demographic groups
Flag explanations shall acknowledge alternative innocent explanations where applicable
System shall provide consistent flagging behavior across similar situations to ensure predictability

legal_compliance.overview: Comprehensive compliance framework ensuring adherence to privacy regulations and providing candidates with fundamental rights throughout the examination process.

key_requirements: Right to erasure (right to be forgotten)
Right to know what data is collected
Right to opt-out of data sale
Written consent before biometric data collection

requirements: Granular consent options for different data types

data_minimization.description: Collection limited to necessary data only
requirements: Option to disable specific monitoring features
Automatic data deletion after retention period
No collection of data beyond stated purposes

data_subject_rights.description: Tools for candidates to exercise their data rights
requirements: Automated data export in portable formats
Encryption at rest and in transit

right_to_appeal.description: Structured process for candidates to contest exam results or integrity violations

stages.name: Appeal Submission
stages.description: Candidate initiates appeal through self-service portal
stages.sla: Submission available immediately after result notification

stages.name: Initial Review
requirements: Automatic routing based on appeal type

stages.name: Evidence Review
stages.description: Detailed review of all relevant evidence
requirements: Full access to exam session recording
Review of all AI flags and explanations

stages.name: Escalation (if requested)
requirements: Review by personnel not involved in initial decision
stages.sla: Within 14 business days of escalation request

right_to_explanation.description: Candidate right to understand automated decisions affecting their exam outcome

requirements.requirement: Candidates shall receive clear explanation of any AI-generated flags that contributed to adverse decisions
Explanations shall describe the specific data inputs that led to the automated decision
Candidates shall have access to view all evidence used in automated decision-making
System shall provide information about how to contest automated decisions
No fully automated adverse decisions - human review required before any negative outcome

compliance_requirements.requirement: System shall obtain explicit, informed consent before collecting biometric data
System shall provide candidates with access to all personal data collected during their exam sessions
System shall support data deletion requests with complete removal within 30 days
System shall maintain detailed audit logs of all data processing activities
System shall provide structured appeals process with defined SLAs for each stage
System shall ensure human review of all AI-generated flags before adverse decisions
System shall provide clear, understandable explanations for all automated decisions
System shall support configurable data retention periods to meet varying regulatory requirements

accessibility.overview: Comprehensive accessibility implementation ensuring the platform is usable by candidates with diverse abilities, with particular emphasis on keyboard-only navigation.

keyboard_navigation.description: Complete platform functionality accessible via keyboard-only interaction

requirements.requirement: All interactive elements shall be reachable and operable using only the keyboard
Visible focus indicator shall be present on all focused elements with minimum 3:1 contrast ratio
Logical tab order following visual layout and reading order
Skip navigation links allowing users to bypass repetitive content
No keyboard traps - users can navigate away from all components
Keyboard shortcuts for common exam actions with customization options
Focus management ensuring focus moves appropriately after dynamic content changes

visual: Screen reader compatibility with ARIA labels and landmarks
Color not used as sole means of conveying information
Minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio for normal text
cognitive: Option to review answers before submission
auditory: Visual alerts as alternative to audio notifications

accommodation_management.description: System for requesting and applying exam accommodations

workflow.name: Accommodation Request
workflow.description: Candidate or administrator submits accommodation request with supporting documentation

workflow.name: Configuration
workflow.description: Approved accommodations applied to candidate's exam profile

workflow.name: Verification
workflow.description: Candidate confirms accommodations before exam start

supported_accommodations.description: Additional time beyond standard exam duration
Scheduled or on-demand breaks during exam
Compatibility mode for screen reader users

accessibility_requirements.requirement: All exam functionality shall be operable using keyboard-only navigation
Platform shall achieve WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance
Screen reader users shall be able to complete all exam tasks independently
System shall support configurable time accommodations without manual intervention
Platform shall undergo annual third-party accessibility audit
Visible focus indicator shall be present on all interactive elements
Keyboard shortcuts shall be customizable to avoid conflicts with assistive technology

fully_automated_processes.description: AI-powered document validation and facial recognition
fully_automated_processes.human_fallback: Manual review queue for failed verifications

fully_automated_processes.description: Automated room scan analysis and system checks
AI behavior analysis and flag generation
fully_automated_processes.human_fallback: None during exam - all review is post-exam

fully_automated_processes.description: Question presentation, timing, and submission handling
Automated scoring and initial result determination
fully_automated_processes.human_fallback: Review required before adverse integrity decisions

human_required_processes.description: Review of AI-generated flags before adverse decisions

Right to human review of contested decisions

human_required_processes.description: Review of accommodation requests requiring judgment
Resolution of edge cases not covered by automation
human_required_processes.rationale: Complex situations benefit from human judgment

stages.automation: Self-service booking with automatic capacity management and conflict detection
Automated reminder sequences, system check prompts, and readiness validation
AI identity verification with real-time feedback and guidance

implementation: Same behavior patterns across all exam sessions
Predictable flag thresholds with no hidden criteria
Version-controlled rule changes with advance notice
Clear communication of what is monitored
Real-time feedback when monitoring detects issues
Published accuracy metrics for AI systems
Regular bias auditing with published results
No punitive action without human review

operational_requirements.requirement: System shall operate fully automated without requiring human proctors during exam sessions
System shall require human review before any adverse integrity decision affecting candidate outcomes
Automated processes shall have defined fallback procedures for failure scenarios
System shall support 99.9% uptime SLA during scheduled exam windows
System behavior shall be consistent and predictable across all candidate sessions
System shall provide real-time operational dashboard for administrators

evidence_viewer.description: Self-service tool allowing candidates to review all evidence from their exam session

capabilities.description: Full video playback of exam session with timeline navigation
requirements: Video player with standard controls (play, pause, seek)
Timestamp display synchronized with exam timeline

capabilities.description: Visual timeline showing all flags with direct navigation
requirements: Chronological flag display on visual timeline
Filter options by flag type and severity
Full flag explanation in plain language
Information about what triggered the flag

Access to audio recording from exam session

capabilities.description: Review of submitted answers with timing information

candidate_access: View own session recording for 30 days after exam

escalation_paths.description: Structured escalation process ensuring appropriate review at each level

levels.name: Initial Review
levels.scope: Review of submitted appeal and evidence
authority: Overturn flag if evidence clearly supports candidate
Escalate to Level 2 if determination uncertain

levels.name: Secondary Review
levels.reviewer: Senior integrity officer or appeals committee
levels.scope: Fresh review of all evidence plus Level 1 findings
authority: Escalate to Level 3 for complex cases
levels.sla: Decision within 10 business days of escalation

levels.name: Executive Review
levels.scope: Review of precedent-setting cases or unresolved disputes
levels.sla: Decision within 20 business days of escalation

automatic_escalation: Candidate explicitly requests escalation after Level 1 decision
criteria_for_level_3: Case may set precedent affecting future decisions

candidate_options: Escalate to next level if available

possible_outcomes.description: Evidence review does not support integrity concern
Technical or procedural issues affected exam

actions: Update record with specific flag resolutions

appeals_requirements.requirement: Candidates shall have access to view complete session recordings and all evidence through self-service portal
Evidence viewer shall provide synchronized playback of video, audio, and screen recording
System shall provide minimum three-level escalation path for appeals
Each escalation level shall have defined SLAs for decision timeline
Appeal decisions shall include detailed written rationale with specific evidence citations

Evidence shall be preserved for minimum 1 year to support appeals process
